Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Students generally secure a position to utilize as their internship, then make arrangements to start working. Occasionally, students may already be employed in a position that would qualify them for internship credit. When a student has been working in a position continuously for any length of time, additional documentation is required to receive credit for the experience. Note that BYU-Idaho does not award credit for past experience, but will consider requests for students who will continue in the future in the same position, or be switching to a new position for their internship.

This documentation ensures that both the student and employer understand that the student is going to be receiving academic credit, and consideration should be given to possibly elevating the duties and responsibilities of the intern. Students should not seek credit for "entry level" positions, but should strive to increase the level of their work.

The guidelines for additional documentation can be found by clicking on the link below.
